meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the hungry dog was downing his food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She was downing her drink as if she hadn't had water in days.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was downing the nuts like they were going out of style.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner was downing all the crumbs on the floor with ease.
meanings.sent5: The child was downing the juice box in record time, leaving nothing behind.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing something or someone down
meanings.sent1: The downing of the opponent in the wrestling match was swift and impressive.
meanings.sent2: The downing of the tree was carefully planned to avoid any damage to nearby buildings.
meanings.sent3: The downing of the balloon at the party caused laughter among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The downing of the prices at the store attracted many customers.
meanings.sent5: The downing of the curtains during the play added a dramatic touch to the scene.

meanings.definition: The action of landing or descending, especially in an aircraft
meanings.sent1: The downing of the plane was smooth and gentle, making the passengers feel safe.
meanings.sent2: The downing of the helicopter on the helipad was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The downing of the hot air balloon in the field surprised the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The downing of the spaceship on the alien planet was a historic moment.
meanings.sent5: The downing of the glider on the runway was executed perfectly by the pilot.
